It belongs to the family Musaceae, which includes bananas and plantains, though it is a small, shrub-like species rather than a true banana. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in the axils of the leaves, and it produces berries that are edible when ripe. Dorstenia caatingae is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of the caatinga biome.
